meanings.definition: To defeat or get the better of by being more clever or cunning.
meanings.sent1: The fox outwits the crow by tricking it with flattery.
meanings.sent2: She always outwits her opponents in chess with strategic moves.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat outwits the dog by hiding in unexpected places.
meanings.sent4: In the game of wits, she consistently outwits her competitors.
meanings.sent5: The detective outwits the criminal by anticipating their every move.

meanings.definition: To surpass in cleverness or cunning.
meanings.sent1: The young inventor outwits even the experienced engineers with his innovative designs.
meanings.sent2: He outwits his classmates in solving riddles with his quick thinking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey outwits the zookeeper by stealing bananas without being caught.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity outwits the competition, making her designs stand out.
meanings.sent5: The magician outwits the audience with his mind-bending illusions.
